clauses.content: By clicking the "I understand" button below these terms, the user confirms that they have read and understood the privacy policy, consent to its wording, and accept it in full.

The Provider is the controller of users' personal data pursuant to Article 4(7) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR). The Provider undertakes to process personal data in accordance with applicable law, in particular the GDPR.

Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person; an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

When placing an order, personal data necessary for the successful processing of the order (name and address, contact details) are required. The purpose of processing personal data is to process the user's order and to exercise the rights and obligations arising from the contractual relationship between the Provider and the User. The purpose is also to send commercial communications and carry out other marketing activities. The legal basis for processing is contract performance (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR), legal obligation (Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR) and the Provider's legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR).

The Provider uses subcontractors for the performance of the licence agreement, in particular mailing and web hosting services. Subcontractors have been verified for secure processing of personal data. The Provider has concluded a data processing agreement with the hosting subcontractor.

The Provider stores users' personal data for the period necessary to exercise rights and obligations arising from the contractual relationship (15 years after termination). After that period, the data will be deleted.

The user has the right to request access to their personal data (Art. 15 GDPR), rectification (Art. 16 GDPR), restriction of processing (Art. 18 GDPR), erasure (Art. 17 GDPR), to object to processing (Art. 21 GDPR) and to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR).
The user has the right to lodge a complaint with the competent data protection supervisory authority if they believe their right to protection of personal data has been infringed.

The user is not obliged to provide personal data. However, provision of personal data is a necessary requirement for concluding and performing the contract; without it, the contract cannot be concluded or performed by the Provider.
The Provider does not carry out automated individual decision-making within the meaning of Article 22 GDPR.
By filling in the contact form, the user:

declares that they do not consider such communications to be unsolicited advertising; and
